data.title: It's On! Demi Lovato and Jonas Brothers Rock the Summer!
data.meta_description: /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- No. 1 selling recording artist Demi Lovato and the multi-platinum-selling artists, the Jonas Brothers are featured on the soundtrack...
data.text:
BURBANK, Calif., July 27 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- No. 1 selling recording artist Demi Lovato and the multi-platinum-selling artists, the Jonas Brothers are featured on the soundtrack of the summer—Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam—set to rock into stores and online retailers on Tuesday, August 10th. The album features 15-all new songs from the movie, including three bonus songs ("Different Summers," "Walkin' In My Shoes" and "It's Not Too Late"). The physical CD also features exciting special bonuses, including the full-length "It's On" music video, exclusive interviews with Demi Lovato and Jonas Brothers, and a movie photo gallery accessible through computer ROM drives. "Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam," premieres Friday, September 3rd on Disney Channel.

The Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam soundtrack will receive its worldwide broadcast debut on Radio Disney's Planet Premiere feature Saturday, August 7th (7:00 p.m., ET/ 4:00 p.m., PT) and Sunday, August 8th (12:00 p.m., ET/ 9:00 a.m., PT). Two of the soundtrack's hits, "It's On," and "Can't Back Down," have been anchored in the Top 10 of Radio Disney's Top 30 Countdown.

After the tremendous success of the original "Camp Rock," which became cable TV's #1 entertainment telecast in Total Viewers (10.1 million) and TV's #1 entertainment telecast among Tweens 9-14 (3.8 million) in 2008, the blockbuster Disney Channel Original Movie catapulted Demi Lovato into a global star and pumped up the volume on the hugely popular Jonas Brothers. In addition, the "Camp Rock" soundtrack sold 2.5 million CDs worldwide and spent a remarkable 10 weeks in the Top 10 on the Billboard 200 Album Chart for that same year.

"Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam" is a full out rock 'n roll musical that celebrates music, dance and the freedom of summer and reminds viewers to 'enjoy the journey.' This summer of fun opens on a high-pitched Camp Rock reunion. All the Camp Rockers have returned, eager to tune up and rock out but a glistening new camp across the lake, Camp Star, poaches Camp Rock's counselors and may put Camp Rock out of business. Mitchie Torres (played by Demi Lovato) steps it up as she challenges the egocentric Camp Star to an end-of-summer performance duel—it's on!

Nick Jonas commented, "In the first movie, music was part of it. This one—music tells the story." Demi Lovato added, "In this movie there are several different kinds of music -- and music is what drives 'Camp Rock 2'."

The accomplished songwriters who contributed to the full out musical film and soundtrack include: Kara DioGuardi, Mitch Allan, Dapo Torimiro, Antonina Armato, Tim James, Jamie Houston, Adam Watts and Andy Dodd.

The three continent Jonas Brothers Live in Concert with Special Guest Demi Lovato plus Special Friends from "Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam" features both artists' hits as well as music from both "Camp Rock" films, embarks on August 7 in Chicago, Illinois. The "Camp Rock" film stars who will join theLive In Concert world tour include Alyson Stoner, Matthew "Mdot" Finley, Anna Maria Perez de Tagle, Roshon Fegan and Jordan Francis.

The Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam soundtrack will be available nationwide on August 10, 2010 wherever music is sold. For more information on Walt Disney Records' releases, please visit DisneyRecords.com, become a fan at Facebook.com/disneymusic or follow us at Twitter.com/disneymusic.

The Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam track list is as follows:

1. Brand New Day Performed by: Demi Lovato

Written by Kara DioGuardi and Mitch Allan

Produced by Kara DioGuardi and Mitch Allan

2. Fire Performed by: Matthew "Mdot" Finley

Written by Lyrica Anderson and Dapo Torimiro

Produced and Mixed by Dapo Torimiro for Dapomiro Productions

3. Can't Back Down Performed by: Demi Lovato, Alyson Stoner and Anna Maria Perez de Tagle

Written by Antonina Armato, Tim James and Tom Sturges

Produced by Antonina Armato and Tim James

4. It's On Performed by: Demi Lovato, Matthew "Mdot" Finley, Meaghan Martin, Jordan Francis, Roshon Fegan and Alyson Stoner

Written by Lyrica Anderson, Kovasciar Myvette and Toby Gad

Produced and Mixed by Toby Gad at Strawberrybee Studios, CA

5. Wouldn't Change a Thing Performed by: Demi Lovato and Joe Jonas

Written by Adam Anders, Nikki Hassman and Peer Astrom

Produced by Adam Anders, Nikki Hassman and Peer Astrom

6. Heart and Soul Performed by: Joe Jonas, Kevin Jonas and Nick Jonas

Written by Antonina Armato, Tim James, Steve Rushton and Aaron Dudley

Produced by Antonina Armato and Tim James

7. You're My Favorite Song Performed by: Demi Lovato and Joe Jonas

Written by Jeannie Lurie, Chen Neeman and Aris Archontis

Produced by Jeannie Lurie, Chen Neeman and Aris Archontis

8. Introducing Me Performed by: Nick Jonas

Written by Jamie Houston

Produced and Mixed by Jamie Houston at B.Y. Studios, Venice, CA

9. Tear It Down Performed by: Matthew "Mdot" Finley and Meaghan Martin

Written by Lyrica Anderson, Kovasciar Myvette and Toby Gad

Produced and Mixed by Toby Gad at Strawberrybee Studios, CA

10. What We Came Here For Performed by: Demi Lovato, Joe Jonas, Nick Jonas, Alyson Stoner and Anna Maria Perez de Tagle

Written by Jamie Houston

Produced by Jamie Houston

11. This Is Our Song Performed by: Demi Lovato, Joe Jonas, Nick Jonas and Alyson Stoner

Written by Adam Watts and Andy Dodd

Produced and Mixed by Adam Watts and Andy Dodd

12. Different Summers (BONUS) Performed by: Demi Lovato

Written by Jamie Houston

Produced and Mixed by Jamie Houston at B.Y. Studios, Venice, CA

13. Walkin' In My Shoes (BONUS) Performed by: Matthew "Mdot" Finley and Meaghan Martin

Written by Lyrica Anderson, Niclas Molinder, Joacim Persson, Johan Alkenas and Pam Sheyne

Produced and Mixed by TWIN and Alke for RedFly

14. It's Not Too Late (BONUS) Performed by: Demi Lovato

Written by Adam Watts and Andy Dodd

Produced and Mixed by Adam Watts and Andy Dodd

15. Rock Hard or Go Home Performed by: Iron Weasel

Written by Stacy Wilde and David Bellochio

Produced by Stacy Wilde and David Bellochio

SOURCE Walt Disney Records
